page.title: 04STANE STREET, N. PULBOROUGH
page.content: The A29 main road from London to Chichester crosses the block from SW to NE and is almost straight. It follows the course of the Roman Road called Stane Street which connected these towns. Whereas the resting places on the Roman road were to the N and S of the block, the modern staging post is the Toat Cafe, which has ample parking space for cars and heavy goods vehicles On alternate Sundays a "car boot" sale is held on the parking area which can develop into a small market. A public house and a petrol filling station cater for the thirsts of modern chariots and their drivers.
